22.verse: My Peace I Give to You - Judas spoke up. (This was the other Judas, not Iscariot.) ‘Master,’ he said, ‘how will it be that you will show yourself to us and not to the world?’

23.verse: ‘If anyone loves me,’ Jesus replied, ‘they will keep my word. My father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.

24.verse: Anyone who doesn’t love me won’t keep my word. And the word which you hear isn’t mine. It comes from the father, who sent me.

25.verse: ‘I’ve said all this to you while I’m here with you.

26.verse: But the helper, the holy spirit, the one the father will send in my name, he will teach you everything. He will bring back to your mind everything I’ve said to you.

27.verse: ‘I’m leaving you peace. I’m giving you my own peace. I don’t give gifts in the way the world does. Don’t let your hearts be troubled; don’t be fearful.

28.verse: You heard that I said to you, “I’m going away, and I’m coming back to you.” If you loved me, you would be happy that I’m going to the father – because the father is greater than me.

29.verse: And now I’ve told you before it happens, so that when it does happen, you may believe.

30.verse: ‘I haven’t got much more to say to you. The ruler of the world is coming. He has nothing to do with me.

31.verse: But all this is happening so that the world may know that I love the father, and that I’m doing what the father has told me to do. ‘Get up. Let’s be going.’

1.verse: The True Vine - ‘I am the true vine’, said Jesus, ‘and my father is the gardener.

2.verse: He cuts off every branch of mine that doesn’t bear fruit; and he prunes every branch that does bear fruit, so that it can bear more fruit.

3.verse: You are already clean. That’s because of the word that I’ve spoken to you.

4.verse: ‘Remain in me, and I will remain in you! The branch can’t bear fruit by itself, but only if it remains in the vine. In the same way, you can’t bear fruit unless you remain in me.

5.verse: I am the vine, you are the branches. People who remain in me, and I in them, are the ones who bear plenty of fruit. Without me, you see, you can’t do anything.

6.verse: ‘If people don’t remain in me, they are thrown out, like a branch, and they wither. People collect the branches and put them on the fire, and they are burned.

7.verse: If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, ask for whatever you want, and it will happen for you.

8.verse: My father is glorified in this: that you bear plenty of fruit, and so become my disciples.’

9.verse: Obeying and Loving - ‘As the father loved me,’ Jesus continued, ‘so I loved you. Remain in my love.

10.verse: If you keep my commands, you will remain in my love, just as I have kept my father’s commands, and remain in his love.

11.verse: I’ve said these things to you so that my joy may be in you, and so that your joy may be full.

12.verse: ‘This is my command: love one another, in the same way that I loved you.

13.verse: No one has a love greater than this, to lay down your life for your friends.

14.verse: You are my friends, if you do what I tell you.

15.verse: I’m not calling you “servants” any longer; servants don’t know what their master is doing. But I’ve called you “friends”, because I’ve let you know everything I heard from my father.

16.verse: ‘You didn’t choose me. I chose you, and I appointed you to go and bear fruit, fruit that will last. Then the father will give you whatever you ask in my name.

17.verse: This is my command to you: love one another.’

18.verse: If the World Hates You - ‘If the world hates you,’ Jesus went on, ‘know that it hated me before it hated you.

19.verse: If you were from the world, the world would be fond of its own. But the world hates you for this reason: that you’re not from the world. No: I chose you out of the world.

20.verse: ‘Remember the word that I said to you: servants are not greater than their masters. If they persecuted me, they will persecute you too. If they kept my word, they will keep yours too.

21.verse: But they will do all these things to you because of my name, because they don’t know the one who sent me.

22.verse: ‘If I hadn’t come and spoken to them, they wouldn’t be guilty of sin. But now they have no excuse for their sin.

23.verse: (Anyone who hates me, hates my father as well!)

24.verse: If I hadn’t done, there in the middle of them, the works which nobody else did, they wouldn’t be guilty of sin. But now they have seen me, and my father – and they’ve hated us both!

25.verse: All this has happened, however, so that the word written in their law might be fulfilled: “They hated me for no reason.”

26.verse: ‘When the helper comes – the one I shall send you from the father, the spirit of truth who comes from the father – he will give evidence about me.

27.verse: And you will give evidence as well, because you have been with me from the start.’

1.verse: The Spirit and the World - ‘I’ve said these things to you’, Jesus went on, ‘to stop you from being tripped up.

2.verse: They will put you out of the synagogues. In fact, the time is coming when anyone who kills you will suppose that they are in that way offering worship to God.

3.verse: They will do these things because they haven’t known the father, or me.

4.verse: But I have been talking to you about these things so that, when their time comes, you will remember that I told you about them. ‘I didn’t say these things to you from the start, because I was with you.

5.verse: But now I’m going to the one who sent me. None of you asks me, “Where are you going?”

6.verse: But because I’ve said these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart.

7.verse: However, it’s the truth that I’m telling you: it’s better for you that I should go away. If I don’t go away, you see, the helper won’t come to you. But if I go away, I will send him to you.

8.verse: ‘When he comes, he will prove the world to be in the wrong on three counts: sin, justice and judgment.

9.verse: In relation to sin – because they don’t believe in me.

10.verse: In relation to justice – because I’m going to the father, and you won’t see me any more.

11.verse: In relation to judgment – because the ruler of this world is judged.’

12.verse: Your Hearts Will Rejoice - ‘There are many things I still have to say to you,’ Jesus continued, ‘but you’re not yet strong enough to take them.

13.verse: When the spirit of truth comes, though, he will guide you in all the truth. He won’t speak on his own account, you see, but he will speak whatever he hears. He will announce to you what’s to come.

14.verse: He will glorify me, because he will take what belongs to me and will announce it to you.

15.verse: Everything that the father has is mine. That’s why I said that he would take what is mine and announce it to you.

16.verse: ‘Not long from now, you won’t see me any more. Then again, not long after that, you will see me!’

17.verse: ‘What’s he talking about?’ some of his disciples asked each other. ‘What’s this business about “not long from now, you won’t see me, and again not long after that you will see me”? And what’s this about “going to the father”?’

18.verse: They kept on saying it. ‘What is this “not long”?’ ‘What’s it all about?’ ‘We don’t know what he means!’

19.verse: Jesus knew that they wanted to ask him. ‘You’re discussing with each other what I meant, aren’t you?’ he said. ‘You want to know what I meant by saying, “Not long from now, you won’t see me; and then again, not long after that, you will see me.” That’s it, isn’t it?

20.verse: Well, I’m going to tell you the solemn truth. ‘You will weep and wail, but the world will celebrate. You will be overcome with sorrow, but your sorrow will turn into joy.

21.verse: When a woman is giving birth she is in anguish, because her moment has come. But when the child is born, she no longer remembers the suffering, because of the joy that a human being has been born into the world.

22.verse: In the same way, you have sorrow now. But I shall see you again, and your hearts will celebrate, and nobody will take your joy away from you.’

23.verse: Ask, and You Will Receive - ‘On that day,’ Jesus went on, ‘you won’t ask me for anything. I’m telling you the solemn truth: whatever you ask the father in my name, he will give you.

24.verse: Up to now, you haven’t asked for anything in my name. Ask, and you will receive, so that your joy may be full!

25.verse: ‘I’ve been saying all this to you in picture-language. The time is coming when I won’t speak in pictures any more. Instead, I’ll tell you about the father quite plainly.

26.verse: On that day you will ask in my name. I won’t say I will ask the father on your behalf,

27.verse: because the father himself loves you! That’s because you have loved me, and have believed that I came from God.

28.verse: I came from the father, and I’ve come into the world. Now I’m leaving the world, and going back to the father.’

29.verse: ‘Ah!’ said his disciples. ‘Now you’re speaking plainly! You’re not talking in pictures.

30.verse: Now we know that you know all things, and you don’t need to have anybody ask you anything. This makes us trust that you came from God.’

31.verse: ‘So you do now believe, do you?’ replied Jesus.

32.verse: ‘Look here: the time is coming (in fact, it’s now arrived!) when you will be scattered, each of you to his own place. You will leave me alone – though I’m not alone, because the father is with me.

33.verse: I’ve said these things to you so that you can have peace in me. You’ll have trouble in the world. But cheer up! I have defeated the world!’

1.verse: Glorify the Son - After Jesus had said this, he lifted up his eyes to heaven. ‘Father,’ he said, ‘the moment has come. Glorify your son, so that your son may glorify you.

2.verse: Do this in the same way as you did when you gave him authority over all flesh, so that he could give the life of God’s coming age to everyone you gave him.

3.verse: And by “the life of God’s coming age” I mean this: that they should know you, the only true God, and Jesus the Messiah, the one you sent.

4.verse: ‘I glorified you on earth, by completing the work you gave me to do.

5.verse: So now, father, glorify me, alongside yourself, with the glory which I had with you before the world existed.

6.verse: ‘I revealed your name to the people you gave me out of the world. They belonged to you; you gave them to me; and they have kept your word.

7.verse: Now they know that everything which you gave me comes from you.

8.verse: I have given them the words you gave me, and they have received them. They have come to know, in truth, that I came from you. They have believed that you sent me.’

9.verse: Jesus Prays for His People - ‘I’m praying for them. I’m not praying for the world, but for the people you’ve given me. They belong to you.

10.verse: All mine are yours; all yours are mine; and I’m glorified in them.

11.verse: ‘I’m not in the world any longer, but they’re still in the world; I’m coming to you. Holy father, keep them in your name, the name you’ve given to me, so that they may be one, just as we are one.

12.verse: ‘When I was with them, I kept them in your name, the name you’ve given me. I guarded them, and none of them has been destroyed (except the son of destruction; that’s what the Bible said would happen).

13.verse: But now I’m coming to you. I’m speaking these things in the world, so that they can have my joy fulfilled in them.

14.verse: ‘I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not from the world, just as I am not from the world.

15.verse: I’m not asking that you should take them out of the world, but that you should keep them from the evil one.

16.verse: They didn’t come from the world, just as I didn’t come from the world.

17.verse: Set them apart for yourself in the truth; your word is truth.

18.verse: Just as you sent me into the world, so I sent them into the world.

19.verse: And on their account I set myself apart for you, so that they, too, may be set apart for you in the truth.’

20.verse: That They May Be One - ‘I’m not praying simply for them. I’m praying, too, for the people who will come to believe in me because of their word.

21.verse: I am praying that they may all be one – just as you, father, are in me, and I in you, that they too may be in us, so that the world may believe that you sent me.

22.verse: ‘I have given them the glory which you have given to me, so that they may be one, just as we are one.

23.verse: I in them, and you in me; yes, they must be completely one, so that the world may know that you sent me, and that you loved them just as you loved me.

24.verse: ‘Father, I want the ones you’ve given me to be with me where I am. I want them to see my glory, the glory which you’ve given me, because you loved me before the foundation of the world.

25.verse: ‘Righteous father, even the world didn’t know you. But I have known you, and these ones have known that you sent me.

26.verse: I made your name known to them – yes, and I will make it known; so that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.’

1.verse: The Arrest of Jesus - With these words, Jesus went out with his disciples across the Kidron valley to a place where there was a garden. He and his disciples went in.

2.verse: Judas, his betrayer, knew the place, because Jesus often used it as a meeting-place with his disciples.

3.verse: So Judas took a band of soldiers, with some servants of the chief priests and the Pharisees, and came there with torches, lights and weapons.

4.verse: Jesus knew everything that was going to happen to him. He went out to meet them. ‘Who are you looking for?’ he asked.

5.verse: ‘Jesus of Nazareth,’ they answered. ‘I’m the one,’ he said to them. Judas, his betrayer, was standing there with them.

6.verse: So when he said, ‘I’m the one,’ they went back a few paces, and fell down on the ground.

7.verse: Jesus repeated his question. ‘Who are you looking for?’ he asked. ‘Jesus of Nazareth,’ they said.

8.verse: ‘I told you, I’m the one!’ said Jesus. ‘So, if you’re looking for me, let these people go.’

9.verse: ( He said this so as to fulfil the word he had spoken, when he said, ‘I haven’t lost any of the people you gave me.’)

10.verse: Simon Peter had a sword. He drew it and hit the high priest’s servant, cutting off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.

11.verse: ‘Put your sword back in its sheath!’ said Jesus to Peter. ‘Do you imagine I’m not going to drink the cup my father has given me?’

12.verse: So the band of soldiers, with the officer and the Judaean attendants, arrested Jesus and tied him up.

13.verse: They led him off first to Annas; he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.

14.verse: It was Caiaphas who had given advice to the Judaeans that the best thing would be for one man to die for the people.

15.verse: Peter Denies Jesus - Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus. That other disciple was known to the high priest; he went in to the high priest’s courtyard along with Jesus,

16.verse: while Peter stood outside by the gate. So the other disciple, being known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the woman on the gate. Then he brought Peter inside.

17.verse: The woman on the gate spoke to Peter. ‘You’re not one of that man’s disciples too, are you?’ she asked. ‘No, I’m not,’ he replied.

18.verse: It was cold. The slaves and the attendants had made a charcoal fire, and they were standing round it, warming themselves. Peter was standing there with them and warming himself.

19.verse: The high priest asked Jesus about his disciples, and about his teaching.

20.verse: ‘I’ve spoken to the world quite openly,’ replied Jesus. ‘I always taught in the synagogue and in the Temple, where all the Judaeans gather. I didn’t say anything in secret.

21.verse: Why are you asking me? There were people who listened to me. Ask them what I said to them. Don’t you see? They know what I said.’

22.verse: When Jesus said that, one of the attendants standing there gave him a slap on the face. ‘Is that how you answer the high priest?’ he said.

23.verse: ‘If I’ve said something wrong,’ replied Jesus, ‘give evidence about what was wrong with it. But if what I said was true, why are you hitting me?’

24.verse: So Annas sent him off, still tied up, to Caiaphas the high priest.

25.verse: Simon Peter, meanwhile, was standing there and warming himself. ‘You’re not one of his disciples, are you?’ they asked him. He denied it. ‘No, I’m not,’ he said.

26.verse: Then one of the high priest’s slaves, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, spoke up. ‘Didn’t I see you in the garden with him?’ he said.

27.verse: Peter denied it once more. Instantly, the cock crowed.

28.verse: Pilate and the Judaeans - So they took Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium, the governor’s residence. It was early in the morning. They didn’t themselves go inside the Praetorium. They were anxious not to pollute themselves, so that they would still be able to eat the Passover.

29.verse: So Pilate went outside and spoke to them. ‘What’s the charge, then?’ he asked. ‘What have you got against this fellow?’

30.verse: ‘If he wasn’t doing wicked things,’ they replied, ‘we wouldn’t have handed him over to you.’

31.verse: ‘Take him yourselves,’ said Pilate to them, ‘and judge him by your own law.’ ‘We’re not allowed to put anyone to death,’ replied the Judaeans.

32.verse: (This was so that the word of Jesus might come true, when he had indicated what sort of death he was going to die.)

33.verse: My Kingdom Is Not from This World - So Pilate went back in to the Praetorium and spoke to Jesus. ‘Are you the King of the Jews?’ he asked.

34.verse: ‘Was it your idea to ask that?’ asked Jesus. ‘Or did other people tell you about me?’

35.verse: ‘I’m not a Jew, am I?’ retorted Pilate. ‘Your own people, and the chief priests, have handed you over to me! What have you done?’

36.verse: ‘My kingdom isn’t the sort that grows in this world,’ replied Jesus. ‘If my kingdom were from this world, my supporters would have fought, to stop me being handed over to the Judaeans. So then, my kingdom is not the sort that comes from here.’

37.verse: ‘So!’ said Pilate. ‘You are a king, are you?’ ‘You’re the one who’s calling me a king,’ replied Jesus. ‘I was born for this; I’ve come into the world for this: to give evidence about the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to my voice.’

38.verse: ‘Truth!’ said Pilate. ‘What’s that?’ With those words, he went back out to the Judaeans. ‘I find this man not guilty!’ he said to them.

39.verse: ‘But look here: you’ve got this custom that I should let someone free at Passover-time. So what about it? Would you like me to release “The King of the Jews”?’

40.verse: ‘No!’ they shouted. ‘We don’t want him! Give us Barabbas!’ Now Barabbas was a brigand.

1.verse: Here’s the Man! - So Pilate then took Jesus and had him flogged.

2.verse: The soldiers wove a crown of thorns, put it on his head, and dressed him up in a purple robe.

3.verse: Then they came up to him and said, ‘Hail, King of the Jews!’ And they slapped him.

4.verse: Pilate went out again. ‘Look,’ he said to them, ‘I’m bringing him out to you, so that you’ll know I find no guilt in him.’

5.verse: So Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple cloak. ‘Look!’ said Pilate. ‘Here’s the man!’

6.verse: So when the chief priests and their attendants saw him, they gave a great shout. ‘Crucify him!’ they yelled. ‘Crucify him!’ ‘Take him yourselves and crucify him!’ said Pilate. ‘I find him not guilty!’

7.verse: ‘We’ve got a law,’ replied the Judaeans, ‘and according to that law he deserves to die! He made himself the son of God!’

8.verse: No King but Caesar - When Pilate heard that, he was all the more afraid.

9.verse: He went back into the Praetorium and spoke to Jesus. ‘Where do you come from?’ he asked. But Jesus gave him no answer.

10.verse: So Pilate addressed him again. ‘Aren’t you going to speak to me?’ he said. ‘Don’t you know that I have the authority to let you go, and the authority to crucify you?’

11.verse: ‘You couldn’t have any authority at all over me’, replied Jesus, ‘unless it was given to you from above. That’s why the person who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.’

12.verse: From that moment on, Pilate tried to let him go. But the Judaeans shouted at him. ‘If you let this fellow go,’ they said, ‘you are no friend of Caesar! Everyone who sets himself up as a king is speaking against Caesar!’

13.verse: So when Pilate heard them saying that, he brought Jesus out and sat down at the official judgment seat, called The Pavement (in Hebrew, ‘Gabbatha’).

14.verse: It was the Preparation day of the Passover, and it was about midday. ‘Look,’ said Pilate, ‘here is your king!’

15.verse: ‘Take him away!’ they shouted. ‘Take him away! Crucify him!’ ‘Do you want me to crucify your king?’ asked Pilate. ‘We have no king’, the chief priests replied, ‘except Caesar!’

16.verse: Then he handed him over to them to be crucified. The King of the Jews - So they took Jesus away.

17.verse: He carried his own cross, and went to the spot called ‘Skull Place’ (in Hebrew, ‘Golgotha’).

18.verse: That was where they crucified him. They also crucified two others, one on either side of him, with Jesus in the middle.

19.verse: Pilate wrote a notice and had it placed on the cross: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS

20.verse: Lots of the Judaeans read this notice, because the place where Jesus was crucified was close to the city. It was written in Hebrew, Latin and Greek.

21.verse: So the chief priests said to Pilate, ‘Don’t write “The King of the Jews”! Write that he said, “I am the King of the Jews”!’

22.verse: ‘What I’ve written,’ replied Pilate, ‘I’ve written.’

23.verse: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, giving each soldier one part. When they came to his tunic, they found that it was a single piece of cloth, woven from top to bottom.

24.verse: ‘Let’s not tear it,’ they said to each other. ‘Let’s throw lots for it, to see who’s going to have it.’ This was so that the Bible would be fulfilled, when it says, They took my clothes and divided them up, they threw the dice to decide on my garments. And that’s what the soldiers did.

25.verse: The Death of Jesus - Jesus’ mother was standing beside his cross. So was her sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, with Mary Magdalene too.

26.verse: Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple he specially loved, standing there. ‘Mother,’ he said. ‘Look! there’s your son.’

27.verse: Then he spoke to the disciple. ‘Look!’ he said. ‘There’s your mother.’ From that time, the disciple welcomed her into his own home.

28.verse: After this, Jesus knew that everything had at last been completed. ‘I’m thirsty,’ he said (fulfilling what the Bible had said).

29.verse: There was a jar there full of sour wine. So they put a sponge filled with the sour wine on a hyssop rod and lifted it to his mouth.

30.verse: Jesus drank it. ‘It’s all done!’ he said. Then he let his head drop, and gave up his spirit.

31.verse: Blood and Water - It was the day of Preparation. The coming sabbath was a very special one, and the Judaeans were anxious that the bodies should not remain on the cross during the sabbath. So they asked Pilate to have the legs of the crucified men broken, and their bodies taken away.

32.verse: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the men who were crucified with Jesus, first the one, then the other.

33.verse: But when they came to Jesus, they saw that he was already dead, so they didn’t break his legs.

34.verse: Instead, one of the soldiers thrust a spear into his side, and blood and water came out.

35.verse: (The one who saw it is giving evidence, and his evidence is true. He knows he’s speaking the truth, so that you too may believe.)

36.verse: These things, you see, came about so that the Bible might come true: ‘No bone of his will be broken.’

37.verse: And, again, another passage in the Bible says, ‘They shall look on the one whom they pierced.’

38.verse: The Burial of Jesus - After this, Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate if he could take Jesus’ body away. He was a disciple of Jesus, but he kept it secret because he was afraid of the Judaeans. Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took his body.

39.verse: Nicodemus came too (the man who, at first, had visited Jesus by night). He brought a concoction of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds in weight.

40.verse: They took Jesus’ body, and wrapped it up in cloths with the spices, according to the normal Judaean burial custom.

41.verse: There was a garden in the place where he was crucified. In the garden, there was a new tomb in which nobody had ever been buried.

42.verse: So, because the tomb was nearby, and because of the Judaean day of Preparation, they buried Jesus there.

1.verse: The Empty Tomb - On the first day of the week, very early, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb while it was still dark. She saw that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb.

2.verse: So she ran off, and went to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, the one Jesus loved. ‘They’ve taken the master out of the tomb!’ she said. ‘We don’t know where they’ve put him!’

3.verse: So Peter and the other disciple set off and went to the tomb.

4.verse: Both of them ran together. The other disciple ran faster than Peter, and got to the tomb first.

5.verse: He stooped down and saw the linen cloths lying there, but he didn’t go in.

6.verse: Then Simon Peter came up, following him, and went into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying there,

7.verse: and the napkin that had been around his head, not lying with the other cloths, but folded up in a place by itself.

8.verse: Then the other disciple, who had arrived first at the tomb, went into the tomb as well. He saw, and he believed.

9.verse: They did not yet know, you see, that the Bible had said he must rise again from the dead.

10.verse: Then the disciples returned to their homes.

11.verse: Mary Magdalene and the Risen Jesus - But Mary stood outside the tomb, crying. As she wept, she stooped down to look into the tomb.

12.verse: There she saw two angels, clothed in white, one at the head and one at the feet of where Jesus’ body had been lying.

13.verse: ‘Woman,’ they said to her, ‘why are you crying?’ ‘They’ve taken away my master,’ she said, ‘and I don’t know where they’ve put him!’

14.verse: As she said this she turned round, and saw Jesus standing there. She didn’t know it was Jesus.

15.verse: ‘Woman,’ Jesus said to her, ‘why are you crying? Who are you looking for?’ She guessed he must be the gardener. ‘Sir,’ she said, ‘if you’ve carried him off somewhere, tell me where you’ve put him, and I will take him away.’

16.verse: ‘Mary!’ said Jesus. She turned and spoke in Aramaic. ‘Rabbouni!’ she said (which means ‘Teacher’).

17.verse: ‘Don’t cling to me,’ said Jesus. ‘I haven’t yet gone up to the father. But go to my brothers and say to them, “I’m going up to my father and your father – to my God and your God.” ’

18.verse: Mary Magdalene went and told the disciples, ‘I’ve seen the master!’ and that he had said these things to her.

19.verse: Jesus and the Disciples - On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the doors were shut where the disciples were, for fear of the Judaeans. Jesus came and stood in the middle of them. ‘Peace be with you,’ he said.

20.verse: With these words, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples were overjoyed when they saw the master.

21.verse: ‘Peace be with you,’ Jesus said to them again. ‘As the father has sent me, so I’m sending you.’

22.verse: With that, he breathed on them. ‘Receive the holy spirit,’ he said.

23.verse: ‘If you forgive anyone’s sins, they are forgiven. If you retain anyone’s sins, they are retained.’

24.verse: Jesus and Thomas - One of the Twelve, Thomas (also known as Didymus), wasn’t with them when Jesus came.

25.verse: So the other disciples spoke to him. ‘We’ve seen the master!’ they said. ‘Unless I see the mark of the nails in his hands,’ replied Thomas, ‘and put my finger into the nail-marks, and put my hand into his side – I’m not going to believe!’

26.verse: A week later the disciples were again in the house, and Thomas was with them. The doors were shut. Jesus came and stood in the middle of them. ‘Peace be with you!’ he said.

27.verse: Then he addressed Thomas. ‘Bring your finger here’, he said, ‘and inspect my hands. Bring your hand here and put it into my side. Don’t be faithless! Just believe!’

29.verse: ‘Is it because you’ve seen me that you believe?’ replied Jesus. ‘God’s blessing on people who don’t see, and yet believe!’

30.verse: Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which aren’t written in this book.

31.verse: But these ones are written so that you may believe that the Messiah, the son of God, is none other than Jesus; and that, with this faith, you may have life in his name.

1.verse: Jesus on the Beach - After this, Jesus showed himself again to the disciples by the sea of Tiberias. This was how he showed himself.

2.verse: Simon Peter, Thomas (known as Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples, were all together.

3.verse: Simon Peter spoke up. ‘I’m going fishing,’ he said. ‘We’ll go with you,’ they replied. So they went off and got into the boat; but that night they caught nothing.

4.verse: As dawn was breaking, Jesus stood beside the seashore, but the disciples didn’t know that it was Jesus.

5.verse: ‘Children,’ said Jesus to them, ‘haven’t you got anything to eat?’ ‘No!’ they replied.

6.verse: ‘Cast the net on the right side of the boat,’ he said, ‘and you’ll find something.’ So they cast the net; and now they couldn’t draw it in because of the weight of the fish.

7.verse: So the disciple that Jesus loved spoke to Peter. ‘It’s the master!’ he said. When Simon Peter heard that it was the master, he wrapped his cloak around him (he had been naked for work), and threw himself into the sea.

8.verse: The other disciples brought the boat in to land, dragging the net full of fish. They weren’t far from shore, about a hundred yards away.

9.verse: Breakfast by the Shore - When they came to land, they saw a charcoal fire laid there, with fish and bread on it.

10.verse: Jesus spoke to them. ‘Bring some of the fish you’ve just caught,’ he said.

11.verse: So Simon Peter went and pulled the net onto the shore. It was full of large fish, a hundred and fifty-three in all. The net wasn’t torn, even though there were so many.

12.verse: ‘Come and have breakfast,’ said Jesus to them. None of the disciples dared ask him, ‘Who are you?’ They knew it was the master.

13.verse: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and so also with the fish.

14.verse: This was now the third time that Jesus had appeared to the disciples after he had been raised from the dead.

15.verse: Jesus and Peter - So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus spoke to Simon Peter. ‘Simon, son of John,’ he said, ‘do you love me more than these?’ ‘Yes, Master,’ he said. ‘You know I’m your friend.’ ‘Well, then,’ he said, ‘feed my lambs.’

16.verse: ‘Simon, son of John,’ said Jesus again, for a second time, ‘do you love me?’ ‘Yes, Master,’ he said. ‘You know I’m your friend.’ ‘Well, then,’ he said, ‘look after my sheep.’

17.verse: ‘Simon, son of John,’ said Jesus a third time, ‘are you my friend?’ Peter was upset that on this third time Jesus asked, ‘Are you my friend?’ ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you know everything! You know I’m your friend!’ ‘Well, then,’ said Jesus, ‘feed my sheep.’

18.verse: ‘I’m telling you the solemn truth,’ he went on. ‘When you were young, you put on your own clothes and went about wherever you wanted. But when you are old, you’ll stretch out your hands, and someone else will dress you up and take you where you don’t want to go.’

19.verse: He said this to indicate the sort of death by which Peter would bring God glory. And when he had said this, he added, ‘Follow me!’

20.verse: The Beloved Disciple - Peter turned and saw, following them, the disciple that Jesus loved. This was the disciple who had leaned back against Jesus’ chest at the supper, and had asked, ‘Master, who is it that’s going to betray you?’

21.verse: ‘Master,’ said Peter to Jesus, seeing him there, ‘what about him?’

22.verse: ‘If it’s my intention’, replied Jesus, ‘that he should remain here until I come, what’s that got to do with you? You must follow me!’

23.verse: So the rumour went around the Christian family that this disciple wouldn’t die. But Jesus didn’t say he wouldn’t die. What he said, rather, was this: ‘If it’s my intention that he should remain here until I come, what’s that got to do with you?’

24.verse: (This is the disciple who is giving evidence about these things, and who wrote them down. We know that his evidence is true.)

25.verse: There are many other things which Jesus did. If they were written down one by one, I don’t think the world itself would be able to contain the books that would be written.
